pullRequest.title: Refactor plugin
pullRequest.bodyText:
There is no new code here. I just split the large Dart file into several less-large files.
Had to upgrade to Gradle 6.4 due to: gradle/gradle#9202
The error message I got was:


Execution failed for task ':flutter-idea:compileJava'.

Unable to find source java class: '/Users/messick/src/flutter/flutter-intellij/flutter-idea/src/main/java/io/flutter/sdk/FlutterSdk.java' because it does not belong to any of the source dirs: '[/Users/messick/src/flutter/flutter-intellij/flutter-idea/src/main/java, /Users/messick/src/flutter/flutter-intellij/flutter-idea/gen, /Users/messick/src/flutter/flutter-intellij/flutter-idea/third_party/vmServiceDrivers, /Users/messick/src/flutter/flutter-intellij/flutter-idea/src/main/resources]'

Getting from there to the Gradle issue took some digging. As you can see, the error message is incorrect.
Next up: Refactor pre-compilation editing, then add a new command to build using Gradle.

nodes.bodyText: Could these also work as statics off of ProductCommand?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,15 @@
+// Copyright 2017 The Chromium Authors. All rights reserved. Use of this source
+// code is governed by a BSD-style license that can be found in the LICENSE file.
+
+const Map<String, String> plugins = const {
+  'io.flutter': '9212',
+  'io.flutter.as': '10139', // Currently unused.
+};
+
+const int cloudErrorFileMaxSize = 1000; // In bytes.
+
+// Globals are initialized early in ProductCommand.
+String rootPath;

nodes.bodyText: This could use a more descriptive name; plugins ==> supportedPlatformVersions'? currentIntelliJVersions`?
